formattedAddress: 510 W 135th St # 7, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 510 W 135th St # 7, New York, NY 10031, USA

originalText.text:
Best dog walkers ever! The Bow Wow Boys always take the best care of our finicky little Frenchie. They've been faithfully and lovingly walking our crazy pup every day for over 2 years. Whenever we have to work a little late or go out of town, we always know that our fur baby is in great hands with the Bow Wow Boys. On top of all this, their online scheduling system makes creating and canceling services incredibly convenient. If I'm going to have to work late, I can schedule them to come over that night, walk, feed and snuggle with our little fur ball. Wish I could give them 100 stars!

PS: They take the best photos of our little nugget on every one of her walks (a service they do for all dogs they walk).

originalText.text: I am just celebrating 3 years with Bow Wow Boys. Bob and Drew are AMAZING! They walk my boy every day and stay at my apartment with my cat and dog while I am away. I always know that they are in the best hands with these guys. They are like family to me and go to the greatest lengths to make sure all of their animals are taken care of and loved. I can not recommend their services enough!

originalText.text: The Bow Wow Boys are fantastic and took great care of our dog for over four years--from when she was a few months old to when we moved out of the neighborhood last month. Drew, Bob, and the walkers on their staff are professional, flexible to schedule changes, and truly caring toward the dogs they walk. Everything you could hope for in a dog walking service!

text.text: The Bow Wow Boys are fantastic and took great care of our dog for over four years--from when she was a few months old to when we moved out of the neighborhood last month. Drew, Bob, and the walkers on their staff are professional, flexible to schedule changes, and truly caring toward the dogs they walk. Everything you could hope for in a dog walking service!

originalText.text:
One of our foster dogs was hit by a car and died due to negligence. The walker did not have his hand looped through the leash, bent down to coddle the dog when she was scared and she was hit by a car.

Walking dogs is a huge responsibility. Coddling a dog when they’re scared is absolutely the worst thing one can do. Aside from this, the walker did not have his hand through the leash.

This was a very tragic experience to say the least.

originalText.text: Amazing Service. They were able to schedule  a visit with me promptly. And start walking my puppy the next day! I also love the fact that they sent pictures and provided details about the walk! I am really happy with the communication and service
